17.summary:
The document outlines various discount programs available for diabetic supplies, physical therapy, and hearing services. Under the diabetic supplies section, customers can receive discounts ranging from 20% to 85% off retail prices. This includes savings on glucose test strips, glucose monitors, lancets, and other related devices. Additionally, discounts are available for blood pressure monitors and urinalysis test strips. Contact information for customer service and billing is provided, along with a website for accessing the program and locating providers.

The physical therapy and rehabilitation section offers an average savings of 20% at over 1,200 offices with 4,000 rehabilitation and physical therapy providers across 23 states. This section also provides customer service and billing contact details, as well as a website for further information and provider locations.

The hearing savings program includes free hearing consultations and exclusive discounts on the latest hearing aid technology. Benefits include free annual hearing consultations at over 3,000 professional locations, exclusive discounts on all hearing aid technologies and styles, a free deluxe warranty program, and up to a 3-year supply of batteries, with 40 cells per hearing aid purchased per year. Contact information and a website for accessing the program are also provided.

18.summary:
The document outlines a medical bill negotiation program designed to assist members in reducing medical expenses that are not covered by their existing plan benefits. Patient advocates are available to negotiate on behalf of members to lower the cost of medical bills. To initiate the negotiation process, a minimum bill amount of $5000 is required, and full payment to the provider or facility must be made once a negotiation is accepted. This service is not provided by AccessOne DMPO. 

Additionally, the document details a discount program for medical supplies and equipment, offering savings ranging from 20% to 50% on various medical supply needs. The program includes a wide selection of items such as ambulatory aids, bathroom safety items, wheelchairs, scooters, and hospital beds. This discount program is accessible through a specified website, and customer service contact information is provided for further assistance.

19.summary:
The Laboratory Savings Program provides an efficient, affordable, and confidential solution for medical laboratory testing. Members can access a wide array of medical laboratory tests, gain information on tests and diseases, and purchase lab tests directly from the website. This program is not available in New York, New Jersey, or Rhode Island. For assistance, customer service can be reached at 877-271-6559, and billing inquiries can be directed to 732-876-9733. More information and provider locations can be found at www.ncegapaffordplus.com.

SDO Nutrition offers support for achieving personal health goals, maintaining a healthy lifestyle, and managing chronic health conditions through food and diet education. The program provides services for weight loss, dietary restrictions, geriatric health, diabetes and high blood pressure management, chronic health conditions management, and nutrition for athletic and fitness training. Customer service and billing contact information is the same as for the Laboratory Savings Program, and further details are available on the same website.

20.summary:
The document outlines two distinct services: speech therapy and a 24/7 nurse help line. The speech therapy service utilizes video conferencing technology to provide live, one-on-one, highly individualized, and interactive sessions. This telepractice model offers an alternative to traditional speech therapy, allowing clients to engage with therapists using therapeutic activities and exercises. The service requires a computer, high-speed internet, a web camera, and a quiet room. Materials and follow-up resources are provided to help patients practice skills learned during sessions.

The 24/7 nurse help line offers access to registered nurses (RNs) who can answer questions on family health issues. This service is available in over 100 languages, providing medical information assistance around the clock. Both services emphasize accessibility and convenience, with customer service and billing contact information provided for further assistance. The document specifies that these programs are not provided by AccessOne DMPO and are part of a discount program.

21.summary:
The Chiropractic Savings Program provides members with a free initial consultation and offers up to 50% savings on diagnostic services and x-rays if necessary. Additionally, members can enjoy unlimited treatments with up to 30% savings through a national network of over 12,000 chiropractors. This program is designed to make chiropractic care more accessible and affordable by leveraging a large network of providers.

In addition to chiropractic savings, the program includes discounts on vitamins and supplements. Members can save up to 75% off retail pricing on a wide selection of natural products, including vitamins and supplements. This aspect of the program aims to support overall health and wellness by providing cost-effective options for essential health products.

The program is not provided by AccessOne DMPO and is explicitly stated as a discount program, not insurance. Members are encouraged to access their program and locate providers through the provided website link.

22.summary:
The document outlines the terms and conditions of the Health Discount Program Member Agreement provided by AccessOne Consumer Health, Inc. It specifies that the plan is not insurance but offers discounts at certain healthcare providers for medical services. Members are required to pay for all healthcare services but can receive discounts from providers within the discount plan organization. The plan does not make payments directly to providers. The agreement includes the effective date of enrollment, which is shown on the Member ID, and continues month to month until cancellation. Members can cancel their participation within thirty days for a full refund of the processing fee, if applicable. After thirty days, cancellation is possible with a pro-rata refund for unused months, provided notification is received at least five business days before the next billing cycle.

The plan includes discounts on services from participating chiropractors, medical equipment suppliers, and rehabilitation services, ranging from 5% to 40%. Labs offer discounts of 5% to 70%, hearing services 5% to 20%, and pharmacies 5% to 40%. Dental discounts range from 15% to 50% per visit, and vision services are available at discounts of 5% to 50%. The agreement emphasizes that it is not a qualified health plan under the Affordable Care Act and is not a Medicare prescription drug plan. Members are encouraged to keep a copy of the agreement for their records. The document also provides contact information for complaints and further inquiries.

23.summary: This page provides information about a discount program offered by the National Benefit Builders, Inc. It is important to note that this program is not an insurance plan but rather a discount program. The page is intended for agent use only and includes branding elements such as the NCE logo and accreditation from the Better Business Bureau, indicating a high rating. The document emphasizes that the program is designed to offer discounts on various services, although specific details about the services or discounts are not provided on this page. The page serves as a cover or introductory slide, setting the context for further details that may be provided in subsequent sections of the document.

9.summary:
The Discount Benefit Program Member Handbook provides an overview of the benefits available to members, emphasizing the inclusion of limited medical benefits alongside valuable discount opportunities. This program is designed to supplement existing medical coverage by offering additional savings on various healthcare services. Members can access discounts on a range of services, which may include dental, vision, and prescription drugs, although specific details are not provided in this section.

The handbook highlights that the program is not an insurance plan but rather a discount program aimed at reducing out-of-pocket expenses for members. It is intended to enhance the value of existing medical benefits by providing cost-saving opportunities. The document suggests that members review their current medical coverage to understand how these discounts can be integrated effectively.

Overall, the handbook serves as an introductory guide to the discount benefits available through NCE Membership, encouraging members to explore the potential savings on healthcare services. It underscores the importance of understanding the distinction between discount programs and traditional insurance coverage.

10.summary: This page provides a table of contents for a health discount program, outlining various services and benefits available to members. The document begins with a welcome section, followed by detailed sections on dental and vision services. Pharmacy benefits are also included, with a specific mention of brand-name mail-order options. Additional sections cover CBD products and diabetic supplies, indicating a focus on diverse health needs. Physical therapy and rehabilitation services are highlighted, along with a hearing savings program, which suggests a comprehensive approach to health and wellness. Medical bill negotiations and medical supplies and equipment are also covered, providing members with tools to manage healthcare costs effectively. The document further includes a laboratory savings program and nutrition services, emphasizing preventive care and wellness. Speech therapy and a 24/7 nurse help line are available, offering support for various health concerns. A chiropractic savings plan and discounts on vitamins and supplements are also part of the program, enhancing the range of benefits. The document concludes with a health discount program member agreement, detailing the terms and conditions of membership.

11.summary:
The GapAfford Plus program is designed to help individuals and families save on out-of-pocket medical expenses, regardless of their current insurance status. It offers savings from the first dollar spent, with no limits, by providing access to pre-negotiated rates similar to those received by insurance companies. This program is particularly beneficial for those with high deductible health plans, no insurance, or those who are under-insured. It also caters to individuals who cannot obtain insurance due to pre-existing conditions or whose plans do not cover certain procedures. Additionally, it is suitable for those in their eligibility waiting period or on COBRA. Notably, everyone is approved without the need for a medical exam.

The program includes all household members, regardless of age, and even covers students away at college. It is important to note that this is not an insurance plan but a reduced fee-for-service program. Participants must pay for services at the time they are rendered, but discounts are available when using participating providers. Enrollment is open to those with existing insurance, provided their provider accepts both.

There are no deductibles, pre-existing condition limitations, medical exams, claim forms, or age restrictions, except for work already in progress. However, the program does not meet the requirements of the PPACA and is not available in certain states, including Alaska, Montana, Rhode Island, Utah, Vermont, and Washington.

12.summary:
The document outlines the benefits of the Aetna Dental Access Network, part of the GapAfford Plus program. Members gain access to a vast network of over 262,000 dental practice locations, offering significant savings on dental services. These savings range from 15-50% per visit on services such as cleanings, x-rays, fillings, root canals, crowns, bridges, and orthodontia. The program highlights several advantages, including no waiting periods, no age restrictions, and no pre-existing condition exclusions, except for ongoing work. There are no benefit maximums, and the program includes cosmetic dentistry and orthodontia. Additionally, it can be used alongside existing dental insurance and includes vision discounts.

A sample dental care savings table is provided, comparing the regional average costs by Aetna with the costs under the Dentachoice program. For example, a periodic oral exam costs $73 on average, but with Dentachoice, it is reduced to $35, resulting in a total savings of $38. Other procedures, such as comprehensive oral exams and x-rays, also show significant savings. The table includes various procedures, detailing the select regional average cost, the average cost with Dentachoice, and the total savings for each procedure. The document notes that prices can change without notice and that actual costs and savings may vary by provider and location.

13.summary:
The OUTLOOK Vision network offers a wide range of discounts and savings through a network of over 12,000 eye care locations nationwide. This network includes ophthalmologists, optometrists, independent optical centers, and national chain locations. The vision program provides significant savings ranging from 10% to 50% on most prescription eyeglasses, frames, and lenses. Additionally, there are savings on contact lenses, excluding disposables, at participating retail locations. Discounts of 10% to 30% are also available on medical eye exams and surgical procedures such as PRK and LASIK, where available and approved.

The document includes a sample of vision care savings, illustrating potential savings at various locations. For example, at Exact Eye Care in Kearney, NE, a frame single vision with polycarbonate is available at a retail price of $129.00, with a member price of $90.30, resulting in a savings of 30%. Similar savings are detailed for other locations and items, such as LensCrafters in Mesa, AZ, and JC Penney in Michigan.

A list of some participating vision care providers is also provided, including well-known names like Pearle Vision, Sears Optical, and LensCrafters, among others. This extensive network ensures that members have access to a wide range of services and products at discounted rates.

15.summary:
The RX Mail-Order program by MedAfford Global offers significant savings on prescription medications, with potential discounts of up to 80% and insulin medication savings of 45% or more. This service is designed to be convenient, easy, and secure, allowing users to order medications online or via phone. To utilize the service, customers can price their medication through the provided website link or by calling the specified number. A valid prescription from a doctor is required to complete the order. Once ordered, medications are shipped directly to the customer, with email confirmation provided.

The document lists commonly ordered brand-name medications with their average prices based on a 90-day supply. For example, Abilify 10mg is priced at $160, Advair Diskus 50/250mcg 180 doses at $144, and Jardiance 25mg at $260. Additionally, commonly ordered generic medications are listed, such as Amlodipine 10mg for $20 and Metformin ER 500mg for $23. These prices do not include a $4.95 shipping fee or insurance costs for shipment. The program is administered by National Benefit Builders, Inc., and it is important to note that this is a discount program, not insurance.

16.summary:
This page introduces the benefits of incorporating CBD into daily health routines, emphasizing its natural ingredients and the purest form of Cannabidiol. It highlights CBD as a safe and effective alternative to prescription painkillers for individuals and pets. The document explains that CBD, or cannabidiol, is a compound found in hemp plants that supports peace and balance without intoxication, allowing for daily use without altering one's state of mind. The page also outlines the company's commitment to providing high-quality CBD products, selecting vendors who offer plant-based relief for a healthier future.

The document details the unique aspects of the CBD products offered, including compliance with the Farm Bill Act of 2018, ensuring the highest quality pharmacist-formulated full-spectrum CBD products. It emphasizes the purity and potency of ingredients, with multi-stage third-party lab testing to verify potency. Additionally, each package includes QR codes linked to lab results, providing transparency and assurance of quality to consumers.

1.summary:
This document provides an overview of the insurance offerings by Everest Reinsurance Company, specifically focusing on the Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance plan. The plan is offered through NCE and utilizes the Multiplan PPO Network, providing a range of provider options for policyholders. The carrier for this insurance type is Everest, known for its structured indemnity plans that offer fixed benefits for various medical services. The plan is designed to offer predictable payouts for covered services, making it easier for policyholders to manage their healthcare expenses. 

The Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance plan is structured to provide specific benefits for hospital stays, outpatient procedures, and other medical services. It is important to note that this type of insurance is not a substitute for major medical insurance but rather serves as a supplemental option to help cover out-of-pocket costs. The plan's benefits are predetermined and paid directly to the policyholder, allowing for flexibility in how the funds are used. 

The Multiplan PPO Network offers a wide range of healthcare providers, enhancing the accessibility of services for policyholders. This network option allows for reduced costs when using in-network providers, although policyholders have the freedom to choose out-of-network providers at potentially higher costs. The document emphasizes the importance of understanding the specific terms and conditions associated with the plan, including any limitations or exclusions that may apply.

2.summary:
This page provides an overview of how Group Indemnity Insurance can assist clients in managing unexpected medical expenses. The insurance offers fixed payments to help cover costs that may not be fully addressed by traditional medical insurance, such as deductibles, copays, and coinsurance. The focus is on providing a cash benefit for covered expenses, allowing clients to use the money as they see fit, whether for medical copays, transportation, or other needs.

An example is provided to illustrate how benefits might be paid under Plan 1000+. In this scenario, a 35-year-old woman incurs expenses after an accident requiring a hospital stay. The plan covers a hospital admission benefit of $1,000, an ER admission benefit of $100, a hospital confinement benefit of $2,000, and a physician office benefit of $75, totaling $3,175. These payouts are estimates and may vary based on the plan offering and individual circumstances.

The page also highlights the advantages of choosing Everest Group Indemnity Insurance, such as access to a Multiplan PPO Network, direct payment of benefits, and a simplified claims process. It is noted that Everest products are limited benefit policies and are not intended to replace major medical coverage. Terms, conditions, and exclusions apply, and clients are advised to read the policy carefully.

3.summary:
The document provides detailed information on the Group Fixed Indemnity Plan options, specifically Plan 100, Plan 200, Plan 200+, and Plan 300. Each plan is designed with specific benefits and coverage limits. All plans have a pre-existing condition limitation of 12-12, meaning conditions that existed 12 months prior to the coverage start date are excluded for the first 12 months of coverage. The underwriting level for all plans is guaranteed issue, ensuring coverage is provided without medical underwriting.

Confinement benefits vary across plans, with Plan 100 offering $100 per day for hospital confinement and $200 for ICU confinement. Plan 200 and Plan 200+ provide $200 per day for both hospital and ICU confinement, while Plan 300 offers $300 per day for these confinements. Hospital benefits include emergency room coverage of $50 per visit across all plans, with Plan 200+ and Plan 300 offering additional surgery benefits of up to three maximum days per certificate year.

Procedure benefits are available in Plan 200+ and Plan 300, with combined inpatient and outpatient coverage of $250 per day. Outpatient benefits include lab and X-ray services, with Plan 200 and Plan 200+ covering $50 per service. Physician's office visits are covered at $50 per visit for all plans, with specific limits on the number of visits per certificate year.

The document also highlights limitations, such as the exclusion of chiropractic and acupuncture coverage, and emphasizes that benefits are per person. Policy terms and conditions may vary by state, and not all benefits may be available in all states.

4.summary:
The document provides detailed information on the Group Fixed Indemnity Plan, comparing four different plans: Plan 500, Plan 750, Plan 1000, and Plan 1000+. Each plan outlines specific benefits, coverage limits, and cost structures. The plans are designed with guaranteed issue underwriting and include a 12-12 pre-existing condition limitation, meaning coverage is limited for conditions treated or diagnosed within 12 months prior to the effective date.

Confinement benefits vary across plans, with hospital confinement coverage ranging from $500 in Plan 500 to $1000 in Plan 1000+. ICU confinement benefits are similarly structured. Hospital benefits include emergency room visits, with coverage from $50 in Plan 500 to $100 in Plan 1000+. Plan 1000+ offers additional hospital admission benefits of $1000.

Procedure benefits cover surgeries with a maximum of three days per certificate year, shared between inpatient and outpatient services. Anesthesia is covered at 25% across all plans. Outpatient benefits include lab, X-rays, advanced diagnostics, and physician's office visits, with coverage amounts increasing from Plan 500 to Plan 1000+.

The document also highlights specific limitations, such as the exclusion of chiropractic or acupuncture coverage and the absence of a cancellation age. Benefits are per person, and policy terms, conditions, exclusions, and limitations may vary by state.

5.summary:
The document provides an overview of Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance, a supplemental health plan that offers a fixed monetary benefit for specific covered medical expenses. This type of insurance is also referred to as indemnity insurance, fixed benefit insurance, or fee-for-service insurance. It is designed to supplement existing health coverage by providing additional financial support for certain medical services. 

Participating providers can be found through the website www.ncegapaffordplus.com or by calling the provided phone number. Members can access plan discounts at participating providers within the network. The document also explains advanced diagnostics, which include a range of tests such as Angiogram, Arteriogram, Bone Marrow Test, and various types of scans like CT, MRI, and PET. 

The term 'Calendar Year' is defined as the period from January 1st to December 31st of any given year, while 'Certificate Year' refers to the plan year as shown in the Certificate Schedule. A free look period is available, allowing the Certificate Holder to return the Certificate within 10 days of receipt for any reason. 

Confinement is defined as being admitted to a hospital for inpatient services, with benefits paid per day of confinement. Diagnostic care encompasses a wide range of medical services aimed at diagnosing medical conditions. The MultiPlan PPO Network is highlighted as a nationwide network providing access to additional providers who offer discounted services.

6.summary:
This document outlines the exclusions and limitations associated with the insurance plan, specifying services, supplies, and treatments that are not covered. Expenses for any services, supplies, and treatments described will not be considered covered, and no benefits will be payable unless otherwise stated. Specific exclusions include breast surgery related to capsular contraction, augmentation, or reduction mammoplasty, except for medically necessary reconstruction following a mastectomy due to cancer. Cosmetic surgery is excluded unless it is reconstructive and necessary due to trauma or disease. Dental care is not covered except for accidental injury to sound natural teeth within 12 months of a covered accident. Elective treatments and surgeries are not payable, nor are experimental or investigational treatments.

The plan also excludes coverage for accidents resulting from participation in extreme sports, such as scuba diving, skydiving, and mountaineering. No benefits are payable for treatments received from family members or for services incurred outside the United States unless they are emergencies approved for use in the U.S. Additionally, no benefits are payable for services provided by individuals who do not normally charge for their services unless there is a legal obligation to pay. These exclusions ensure that the plan focuses on medically necessary treatments and emergencies, with specific conditions outlined for coverage limitations.

7.summary:
This document outlines specific exclusions and limitations on coverage for various conditions under the insurance plan. It specifies that no benefits are payable for treatments, services, or supplies related to gender-related conditions, including gender reassignment and treatments to enhance sexual energy or performance. Additionally, injuries sustained during hazardous activities or occupations, especially those involving compensation, are not covered. This includes activities such as skiing, horse riding, and professional sports at national or international levels.

The plan also excludes coverage for losses resulting from illegal acts or while the insured person is incarcerated. Intoxication exclusions apply, where no benefits are payable if the insured person is deemed intoxicated, as determined by legal blood alcohol levels. Similarly, losses due to narcotic influence are not covered unless prescribed by a physician.

Mental illness and substance abuse treatments are generally excluded, except for specific benefits outlined in the plan's benefit provisions. Overdose-related medical conditions are not covered unless the substance was administered under medical advice. Pregnancy-related treatments, including maternity and childbirth, are excluded unless the life of the covered person is endangered. Lastly, no benefits are payable for losses incurred while participating in military actions or supporting such forces, whether nationally or internationally.

8.summary:
This document outlines specific limitations and exclusions related to various conditions and activities under the insurance plan. It specifies that no benefits are payable for manipulations of the musculoskeletal system or acupuncture, particularly when related to nerve interference or vertebral column issues. Sports-related injuries, especially those from intercollegiate, interscholastic, or professional athletics, are also excluded, although local community sports activities are not affected. Additionally, losses due to suicide or intentional injury, even if unintended, are not covered.

The document further details that accidents involving an unlicensed driver are not covered unless the driver holds a valid learner's permit and is receiving instruction. Losses from war, riots, or insurrections, whether declared or undeclared, are excluded, as are acts of terrorism unless the insured was directly affected. Weight-related treatments, including surgeries and fitness programs, are not covered, nor are memberships or nutritional counseling.

Workers' compensation-related conditions are excluded if they are eligible for benefits under other laws. Pre-existing conditions are not covered for a continuous period of 12 months, except for newborns or adopted children. A waiting period is required before certain benefits become payable, with specific provisions for newborns and adopted children. These exclusions and limitations are crucial for understanding the scope of coverage and the conditions under which benefits are not payable.

presentation.content:
# Cover
- **Plan Name:** Everest Reinsurance Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance
- **Tagline:** "Predictable Payouts for Unpredictable Healthcare Costs"

# Plan Overview
- **Target Audience:** Individuals and Families
- **Offerings:** Supplemental healthcare coverage with fixed benefits
- **Key Benefits:** Accessibility through Multiplan PPO Network, predictable payouts, and flexibility in fund usage

# Core Plan Elements
## Slide 1
- **Coverage Areas:** Hospital stays, outpatient procedures, physician services
- **Plan Structure:** Fixed indemnity with predetermined benefits
- **Eligibility:** Guaranteed issue, no medical underwriting required

## Slide 2
- **Network:** Multiplan PPO Network for reduced costs with in-network providers
- **Flexibility:** Freedom to choose out-of-network providers at higher costs
- **Focus:** Supplemental coverage, not a replacement for major medical insurance

# Common Service Features
## Slide 1
- **Provider Networks:** Access to a wide range of healthcare providers
- **Claims Management:** Direct payment of benefits to policyholders

## Slide 2
- **Support Tools:** Simplified claims process, wellness programs
- **Advocacy Services:** Assistance in navigating healthcare options

# Plan Tiers Breakdown
## Plan 100
- **Hospital Confinement:** $100 per day
- **ICU Confinement:** $200 per day
- **Emergency Room Visits:** $50 per visit
- **Physician's Office Visits:** $50 per visit, 3 visits per year
- **Outpatient Benefits:** Limited to X-rays and labs

## Plan 200
- **Hospital Confinement:** $200 per day
- **ICU Confinement:** $200 per day
- **Emergency Room Visits:** $50 per visit
- **Physician's Office Visits:** $50 per visit, 3 visits per year
- **Outpatient Benefits:** Includes X-rays, labs, and advanced diagnostics

## Plan 200+
- **Hospital Confinement:** $200 per day
- **ICU Confinement:** $200 per day
- **Emergency Room Visits:** $50 per visit
- **Physician's Office Visits:** $50 per visit, 3 visits per year
- **Procedure Benefits:** Surgery coverage for 3 days per year

## Plan 300
- **Hospital Confinement:** $300 per day
- **ICU Confinement:** $300 per day
- **Emergency Room Visits:** $50 per visit
- **Physician's Office Visits:** $50 per visit, 3 visits per year
- **Procedure Benefits:** Surgery coverage for 3 days per year

## Plan 500
- **Hospital Confinement:** $500 per day
- **ICU Confinement:** $500 per day
- **Emergency Room Visits:** $50 per visit
- **Physician's Office Visits:** $50 per visit, 5 visits per year
- **Procedure Benefits:** Surgery coverage for 3 days per year

## Plan 750
- **Hospital Confinement:** $750 per day
- **ICU Confinement:** $750 per day
- **Emergency Room Visits:** $75 per visit
- **Physician's Office Visits:** $50 per visit, 5 visits per year
- **Procedure Benefits:** Surgery coverage for 3 days per year

## Plan 1000
- **Hospital Confinement:** $1000 per day
- **ICU Confinement:** $1000 per day
- **Emergency Room Visits:** $100 per visit
- **Physician's Office Visits:** $75 per visit, 5 visits per year
- **Procedure Benefits:** Surgery coverage for 3 days per year

## Plan 1000+
- **Hospital Confinement:** $1000 per day
- **ICU Confinement:** $1000 per day
- **Emergency Room Visits:** $100 per visit
- **Hospital Admission:** $1000 per admission
- **Physician's Office Visits:** $75 per visit, 5 visits per year
- **Procedure Benefits:** Surgery coverage for 3 days per year

# Comparison Slides
| Benefit Category          | Plan 100 | Plan 200 | Plan 200+ | Plan 300 | Plan 500 | Plan 750 | Plan 1000 | Plan 1000+ |
|---------------------------|----------|----------|-----------|----------|----------|----------|-----------|------------|
| Hospital Confinement      | $100     | $200     | $200      | $300     | $500     | $750     | $1000     | $1000      |
| ICU Confinement           | $200     | $200     | $200      | $300     | $500     | $750     | $1000     | $1000      |
| Emergency Room Visits     | $50      | $50      | $50       | $50      | $50      | $75      | $100      | $100       |
| Physician's Office Visits | $50      | $50      | $50       | $50      | $50      | $50      | $75       | $75        |
| Surgery Coverage          | N/A      | N/A      | 3 days    | 3 days   | 3 days   | 3 days   | 3 days    | 3 days     |

# Limitations and Exclusions
## Slide 1
- **Exclusions:** Pre-existing conditions, cosmetic surgery, dental care (except accidental injury)
- **Limitations:** Chiropractic and acupuncture not covered, sports-related injuries excluded

## Slide 2
- **Additional Exclusions:** Gender-related treatments, hazardous activities, illegal acts
- **Waiting Periods:** 12-month exclusion for pre-existing conditions

# Key Takeaways and Action Steps
- **Flexibility:** Offers predictable payouts and supplemental coverage
- **Cost vs. Coverage:** Balances affordability with essential benefits
- **Next Steps:** Review plan details, contact for enrollment support

# Thank You
- **Message:** Thank you for considering Everest Reinsurance Group for your supplemental healthcare needs.

script.content:
---- Cover ----

Hello, everyone! Thank you for joining today's session on the Everest Reinsurance Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance. We'll walk through this plan's features and benefits, designed to provide predictable payouts for unpredictable healthcare costs. Let's get started!

---- Everest Reinsurance Group Overview ----

The Everest Reinsurance Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance is offered through NCE. 

This plan provides Fixed Indemnity Insurance, which means you receive a set payment amount for various medical services. 

It utilizes the Multiplan PPO Network, offering support tools to enhance your healthcare experience. 

With structured plans, you can expect predictable payouts, making it easier to manage healthcare expenses. 

This insurance serves as supplemental coverage, supporting your existing healthcare plans.

Now, let's explore the key features and benefits.

---- Key Features and Benefits ----

This plan offers fixed payments, ensuring you know exactly what to expect. 

Predictable payouts are a hallmark of this insurance, providing financial peace of mind. 

The wide provider network through the Multiplan PPO Network allows for extensive access to healthcare services. 

Supplemental coverage varies by plan, offering flexibility to meet your needs.

Direct payment is facilitated through the Multiplan PPO Network, streamlining the process for you.

Let's move on to cost management tools.

---- Cost Management Tools ----

The Multiplan PPO Network, or MPN, is a key component of cost management. 

The structured indemnity system ensures that benefits are clear and consistent. 

Direct payment support simplifies the claims process, making it more efficient for policyholders.

Next, we'll discuss how the Multiplan PPO Network works.

---- How Multiplan PPO Network Works ----

To begin, you enroll through NCE, gaining access to a wide range of providers. 

Utilize network discounts to manage healthcare costs effectively. 

You'll receive MPN documentation to help navigate your options. 

This network helps manage healthcare expenses while offering flexible coverage.

Now, let's look at preventive care and wellness.

---- Preventive Care and Wellness ----

The plan includes hospital stay services to support your health needs. 

Outpatient procedures programs are available to ensure comprehensive care. 

The Multiplan PPO Network provides access to these essential services.

Let's explore telehealth services next.

---- Telehealth Services ----

Enjoy twenty-four-seven access to healthcare professionals through telehealth services. 

Virtual consultations offer convenience and flexibility for your healthcare needs. 

Remote monitoring is available, ensuring continuous care. 

This service provides convenient access to care, wherever you are.

Now, let's discuss advocacy and support services.

---- Advocacy and Support Services ----

The plan includes healthcare advocacy to guide you through your options. 

Claims assistance support is available to help manage your benefits. 

Provider options guidance ensures you make informed decisions. 

Benefit utilization support helps you maximize your plan's offerings.

Let's dive into the details of Plan 100.

---- Plan 100 (One of Two) ----

Plan 100 offers hospital confinement benefits of one hundred dollars per day, up to thirty days per confinement and ninety days per certificate year. 

Emergency room visits are covered at fifty dollars per visit. 

ICU confinement is covered at two hundred dollars per day, for up to thirty days per confinement. 

Outpatient benefits include physician's office visits at fifty dollars per visit, with three visits per certificate year.

Let's continue with Plan 100.

---- Plan 100 (Two of Two) ----

Procedure benefits are not applicable under Plan 100. 

Anesthesia coverage is also not applicable.

Now, let's look at Plan 200.

---- Plan 200 (One of Two) ----

Plan 200 provides hospital confinement benefits of two hundred dollars per day, for up to thirty days per confinement and ninety days per certificate year. 

Emergency room visits remain at fifty dollars per visit. 

ICU confinement is covered at two hundred dollars per day, for up to thirty days per confinement. 

Outpatient benefits include X-rays and labs at fifty dollars per service, with four covered days per certificate year.

Let's continue with Plan 200.

---- Plan 200 (Two of Two) ----

Procedure benefits include surgery coverage for three maximum days per certificate year. 

Anesthesia is covered at twenty-five percent.

Now, let's explore Plan 300.

---- Plan 300 (One of Two) ----

Plan 300 offers hospital confinement benefits of three hundred dollars per day, for up to thirty days per confinement and ninety days per certificate year. 

Emergency room visits are covered at fifty dollars per visit. 

ICU confinement is covered at three hundred dollars per day, for up to thirty days per confinement. 

Outpatient benefits include physician's office visits at fifty dollars per visit, with three visits per certificate year.

Let's continue with Plan 300.

---- Plan 300 (Two of Two) ----

Procedure benefits include surgery coverage for three maximum days per certificate year. 

Anesthesia is covered at twenty-five percent.

Now, let's look at Plan 500.

---- Plan 500 (One of Two) ----

Plan 500 provides hospital confinement benefits of five hundred dollars per day, for up to thirty days per confinement and ninety days per certificate year. 

Emergency room visits are covered at fifty dollars per visit. 

ICU confinement is covered at five hundred dollars per day, for up to thirty days per confinement. 

Outpatient benefits include X-rays and labs at fifty dollars per service, with six covered days per certificate year.

Let's continue with Plan 500.

---- Plan 500 (Two of Two) ----

Procedure benefits include surgery coverage for three maximum days per certificate year. 

Anesthesia is covered at twenty-five percent.

Now, let's explore Plan 750.

---- Plan 750 (One of Two) ----

Plan 750 offers hospital confinement benefits of seven hundred fifty dollars per day, for up to thirty days per confinement and ninety days per certificate year. 

Emergency room visits are covered at seventy-five dollars per visit. 

ICU confinement is covered at seven hundred fifty dollars per day, for up to thirty days per confinement. 

Outpatient benefits include X-rays and labs at fifty dollars per service, with eight covered days per certificate year.

Let's continue with Plan 750.

---- Plan 750 (Two of Two) ----

Procedure benefits include surgery coverage for three maximum days per certificate year. 

Anesthesia is covered at twenty-five percent.

Now, let's look at Plan 1000.

---- Plan 1000 (One of Two) ----

Plan 1000 provides hospital confinement benefits of one thousand dollars per day, for up to thirty days per confinement and ninety days per certificate year. 

Emergency room visits are covered at one hundred dollars per visit. 

ICU confinement is covered at one thousand dollars per day, for up to thirty days per confinement. 

Outpatient benefits include X-rays and labs at seventy-five dollars per service, with twelve covered days per certificate year.

Let's continue with Plan 1000.

---- Plan 1000 (Two of Two) ----

Procedure benefits include surgery coverage for three maximum days per certificate year. 

Anesthesia is covered at twenty-five percent.

Now, let's explore Plan 1000+.

---- Plan 1000+ (One of Two) ----

Plan 1000+ offers hospital confinement benefits of one thousand dollars per day, for up to thirty days per confinement and ninety days per certificate year. 

Emergency room visits are covered at one hundred dollars per visit. 

ICU confinement is covered at one thousand dollars per day, for up to thirty days per confinement. 

Outpatient benefits include X-rays and labs at one hundred dollars per service, with twelve covered days per certificate year.

Let's continue with Plan 1000+.

---- Plan 1000+ (Two of Two) ----

Procedure benefits include surgery coverage for three maximum days per certificate year. 

Anesthesia is covered at twenty-five percent.

Now, let's compare the plans.

---- Comparing the Plans (One of Two) ----

Let's compare the features of Plan 100, Plan 200, and Plan 300. 

Hospital confinement benefits range from one hundred dollars to three hundred dollars per day. 

ICU confinement is consistent at two hundred dollars for Plan 100 and Plan 200, increasing to three hundred dollars for Plan 300. 

Emergency room visits are covered at fifty dollars across all three plans. 

Surgery coverage is not applicable for Plan 100, but is available at two hundred fifty dollars per day for Plan 200 and Plan 300. 

Anesthesia is not applicable for Plan 100, but is covered at twenty-five percent for Plan 200 and Plan 300.

Let's continue comparing the plans.

---- Comparing the Plans (Two of Two) ----

Now, let's compare Plan 500, Plan 750, Plan 1000, and Plan 1000+. 

Hospital confinement benefits range from five hundred dollars to one thousand dollars per day. 

ICU confinement follows the same range, from five hundred dollars to one thousand dollars per day. 

Emergency room visits are covered at fifty dollars for Plan 500, increasing to seventy-five dollars for Plan 750, and one hundred dollars for Plan 1000 and Plan 1000+. 

Surgery coverage increases from three hundred fifty dollars for Plan 500 to five hundred dollars for Plan 1000 and Plan 1000+. 

Anesthesia is consistently covered at twenty-five percent across these plans.

Let's review important definitions and limitations.

---- Definitions and Limitations ----

Pre-existing conditions have a twelve-twelve limitation, which applies to all plans. 

Coverage exclusions include cosmetic surgery and dental care, except for accidental injury. 

Activity exclusions cover extreme sports and illegal acts. 

Other limitations include exclusions for intoxication and military actions.

Now, let's summarize the key takeaways and reminders.

---- Key Takeaways and Reminders ----

The plan offers fixed indemnity benefits, providing predictable payouts. 

A wide provider network is included, enhancing access to healthcare services. 

Supplemental coverage benefits support your existing healthcare plans. 

Understanding exclusions is crucial to making informed decisions.

---- Closing ----

Thank you for participating in the Everest Reinsurance Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance Review. We hope this information helps you make informed decisions about your healthcare coverage. Continue to be great!

script.content:
Let's compare the features of Plan 100, Plan 200, and Plan 300. 

Hospital confinement benefits range from one hundred dollars to three hundred dollars per day. 

ICU confinement is consistent at two hundred dollars for Plan 100 and Plan 200, increasing to three hundred dollars for Plan 300. 

Emergency room visits are covered at fifty dollars across all three plans. 

Surgery coverage is not applicable for Plan 100, but is available at two hundred fifty dollars per day for Plan 200 and Plan 300. 

Anesthesia is not applicable for Plan 100, but is covered at twenty-five percent for Plan 200 and Plan 300.

Let's continue comparing the plans.

slide.frontmatter:
transition: fade-out
layout: default

script.content:
Now, let's compare Plan 500, Plan 750, Plan 1000, and Plan 1000+. 

Hospital confinement benefits range from five hundred dollars to one thousand dollars per day. 

ICU confinement follows the same range, from five hundred dollars to one thousand dollars per day. 

Emergency room visits are covered at fifty dollars for Plan 500, increasing to seventy-five dollars for Plan 750, and one hundred dollars for Plan 1000 and Plan 1000+. 

Surgery coverage increases from three hundred fifty dollars for Plan 500 to five hundred dollars for Plan 1000 and Plan 1000+. 

Anesthesia is consistently covered at twenty-five percent across these plans.

slide.content:
## Definitions and Limitations

<v-click>

**Pre-existing Conditions**
- 12-12 limitation
- Applies to all plans

</v-click>

<v-click>

- Dental care (except accidental injury)

</v-click>

<v-click>

**Activity Exclusions**

- Illegal acts

</v-click>

**Other Limitations**

- Military actions

</v-click>

script.content:
Pre-existing conditions have a twelve-twelve limitation, which applies to all plans. 

Coverage exclusions include cosmetic surgery and dental care, except for accidental injury. 

Activity exclusions cover extreme sports and illegal acts. 

Other limitations include exclusions for intoxication and military actions.
